verses.verse: Then <S%G5119><s%> Pilate <S%G4091><s%> therefore <S%G3767><s%> took <S%G2983><s%> Jesus, <S%G2424><s%> and scourged <S%G3146><s%> Him.

And the soldiers <S%G4757><s%> wove <S%G4120><s%> a crown <S%G4735><s%> of thorns <S%G173><s%> and put <S%G2007><s%> it on His head, <S%G2776><s%> and arrayed <S%G4016><s%> Him in a purple <S%G4210><s%> robe; <S%G2440><s%>

and they [began] to come <S%G2064><s%> up to Him, and say, <S%G3004><s%> "Hail, <S%G5463><s%> King <S%G935><s%> of the Jews! <S%G2453><s%>" and to give <S%G1325><s%> Him blows <S%G4475><s%> [in the face.]

And Pilate <S%G4091><s%> came <S%G1831><s%> out again, <S%G3825><s%> and said <S%G3004><s%> to them, "Behold, <S%G2396><s%> I am bringing <S%G71><s%> Him out to you, that you may know <S%G1097><s%> that I find <S%G2147><s%> no <S%G3762><s%> guilt <S%G156><s%> in Him."

Jesus <S%G2424><s%> therefore <S%G3767><s%> came <S%G1831><s%> out, wearing <S%G5409><s%> the crown <S%G4735><s%> of thorns <S%G174><s%> and the purple <S%G4210><s%> robe. <S%G2440><s%> And [Pilate] said <S%G3004><s%> to them, "Behold, <S%G2400><s%> the Man! <S%G444><s%>"

When <S%G3753><s%> therefore <S%G3767><s%> the chief <S%G749><s%> priests <S%G749><s%> and the officers <S%G5257><s%> saw <S%G3708><s%> Him, they cried <S%G2905><s%> out, saying, <S%G3004><s%> "Crucify, <S%G4717><s%> crucify! <S%G4717><s%>" Pilate <S%G4091><s%> said <S%G3004><s%> to them, "Take <S%G2983><s%> Him yourselves, <S%G4771><s%> and crucify <S%G4717><s%> Him, for I find <S%G2147><s%> no <S%G3756><s%> guilt <S%G156><s%> in Him."

The Jews <S%G2453><s%> answered <S%G611><s%> him, "We have <S%G2192><s%> a law, <S%G3551><s%> and by that law <S%G3551><s%> He ought <S%G3784><s%> to die <S%G599><s%> because <S%G3754><s%> He made <S%G4160><s%> Himself <S%G1438><s%> out [to be] the Son <S%G5207><s%> of God. <S%G2316><s%>"
When <S%G3753><s%> Pilate <S%G4091><s%> therefore <S%G3767><s%> heard <S%G191><s%> this <S%G3778><s%> statement, <S%G3056><s%> he was the more <S%G3123><s%> afraid; <S%G5399><s%>

and he entered <S%G1525><s%> into the Praetorium <S%G4232><s%> again, <S%G3825><s%> and said <S%G3004><s%> to Jesus, <S%G2424><s%> "Where <S%G4159><s%> are You from?" But Jesus <S%G2424><s%> gave <S%G1325><s%> him no <S%G3756><s%> answer. <S%G612><s%>

Pilate <S%G4091><s%> therefore <S%G3767><s%> said <S%G3004><s%> to Him, "You do not speak <S%G2980><s%> to me? Do You not know <S%G3609><s%> that I have <S%G2192><s%> authority <S%G1849><s%> to release <S%G630><s%> You, and I have <S%G2192><s%> authority <S%G1849><s%> to crucify <S%G4717><s%> You?"

Jesus <S%G2424><s%> answered, <S%G611><s%> "You would have <S%G2192><s%> no <S%G3756><s%> <S%G3762><s%> authority <S%G1849><s%> over <S%G2596><s%> Me, unless <S%G1487><s%> <S%G3361><s%> it had been <S%G1510><s%> given <S%G1325><s%> you from above; <S%G509><s%> for this <S%G3778><s%> reason <S%G1223><s%> he who delivered <S%G3860><s%> Me up to you has <S%G2192><s%> [the] greater <S%G3173><s%> sin. <S%G266><s%>"

As a result <S%G1537><s%> of this <S%G3778><s%> Pilate <S%G4091><s%> made <S%G2212><s%> efforts <S%G2212><s%> to release <S%G630><s%> Him, but the Jews <S%G2453><s%> cried <S%G2905><s%> out, saying, <S%G3004><s%> "If <S%G1437><s%> you release <S%G630><s%> this <S%G3778><s%> Man, <S%G3778><s%> you are no <S%G3756><s%> friend <S%G5384><s%> of Caesar; <S%G2541><s%> everyone <S%G3956><s%> who makes <S%G4160><s%> himself <S%G1438><s%> out [to be] a king <S%G935><s%> opposes <S%G483><s%> Caesar. <S%G2541><s%>"

When Pilate <S%G4091><s%> therefore <S%G3767><s%> heard <S%G191><s%> these <S%G3778><s%> words, <S%G3056><s%> he brought <S%G71><s%> Jesus <S%G2424><s%> out, and sat <S%G2523><s%> down <S%G2523><s%> on the judgment <S%G968><s%> seat <S%G968><s%> at a place <S%G5117><s%> called <S%G3004><s%> The Pavement, <S%G3038><s%> but in Hebrew, <S%G1447><s%> Gabbatha. <S%G1042><s%>

Now <S%G1161><s%> it was the day <S%G3904><s%> of preparation <S%G3904><s%> for the Passover; <S%G3957><s%> it was about <S%G5613><s%> the sixth <S%G1623><s%> hour. <S%G5610><s%> And he said <S%G3004><s%> to the Jews, <S%G2453><s%> "Behold, <S%G2396><s%> your King! <S%G935><s%>"

They therefore <S%G3767><s%> cried <S%G2905><s%> out, "Away <S%G142><s%> with [Him], away <S%G142><s%> with [Him,] crucify <S%G4717><s%> Him!" Pilate <S%G4091><s%> said <S%G3004><s%> to them, "Shall I crucify <S%G4717><s%> your King <S%G935><s%>?" The chief <S%G749><s%> priests <S%G749><s%> answered, <S%G611><s%> "We have <S%G2192><s%> no <S%G3756><s%> king <S%G935><s%> but Caesar. <S%G2541><s%>"
So <S%G3767><s%> he then <S%G5119><s%> delivered <S%G3860><s%> Him to them to be crucified. <S%G4717><s%>

They took <S%G3880><s%> Jesus <S%G2424><s%> therefore, <S%G3767><s%> and He went <S%G1831><s%> out, bearing <S%G941><s%> His own <S%G1438><s%> cross, <S%G4716><s%> to the place called <S%G3004><s%> the Place <S%G5117><s%> of a Skull, <S%G2898><s%> which <S%G3739><s%> is called <S%G3004><s%> in Hebrew, <S%G1447><s%> Golgotha. <S%G1115><s%>

There <S%G3699><s%> they crucified <S%G4717><s%> Him, and with Him two <S%G1417><s%> other <S%G243><s%> men, <S%G243><s%> one on either <S%G1782><s%> side, <S%G1782><s%> and Jesus <S%G2424><s%> in between. <S%G3319><s%>

And Pilate <S%G4091><s%> wrote <S%G1125><s%> an inscription <S%G5102><s%> also, <S%G2532><s%> and put <S%G5087><s%> it on the cross. <S%G4716><s%> And it was written, <S%G1125><s%> "JESUS <S%G2424><s%> THE NAZARENE, <S%G3480><s%> THE KING <S%G935><s%> OF THE JEWS. <S%G2453><s%>"

Therefore <S%G3767><s%> this <S%G3778><s%> inscription <S%G5102><s%> many <S%G4183><s%> of the Jews <S%G2453><s%> read, <S%G314><s%> for the place <S%G5117><s%> where <S%G3699><s%> Jesus <S%G2424><s%> was crucified <S%G4717><s%> was near <S%G1451><s%> the city; <S%G4172><s%> and it was written <S%G1125><s%> in Hebrew, <S%G1447><s%> Latin, <S%G4515><s%> [and] in Greek. <S%G1676><s%>

And so <S%G3767><s%> the chief <S%G749><s%> priests <S%G749><s%> of the Jews <S%G2453><s%> were saying <S%G3004><s%> to Pilate, <S%G4091><s%> "Do not write, <S%G1125><s%> 'The King <S%G935><s%> of the Jews <S%G2453><s%>'; but that He said, <S%G3004><s%> 'I am <S%G1510><s%> King <S%G935><s%> of the Jews. <S%G2453><s%> '"
Pilate <S%G4091><s%> answered, <S%G611><s%> "What <S%G3739><s%> I have written <S%G1125><s%> I have written. <S%G1125><s%>"

The soldiers <S%G4757><s%> therefore, <S%G3767><s%> when <S%G3753><s%> they had crucified <S%G4717><s%> Jesus, <S%G2424><s%> took <S%G2983><s%> His outer <S%G2440><s%> garments <S%G2440><s%> and made <S%G4160><s%> four <S%G5064><s%> parts, <S%G3313><s%> a part <S%G3313><s%> to every <S%G1538><s%> soldier <S%G4757><s%> and [also] the tunic; <S%G5509><s%> now <S%G1161><s%> the tunic <S%G5509><s%> was seamless, <S%G7018><s%> woven <S%G5307><s%> in one <S%G3650><s%> piece. <S%G3650><s%>

They said <S%G3004><s%> therefore <S%G3767><s%> to one <S%G240><s%> another, <S%G240><s%> "Let us not tear <S%G4977><s%> it, but cast <S%G2975><s%> lots <S%G2975><s%> for it, [to decide] whose <S%G5101><s%> it shall be"; that the Scripture <S%G1124><s%> might be fulfilled, <S%G4137><s%> "They divided <S%G1266><s%> My outer <S%G2440><s%> garments <S%G2440><s%> among <S%G1266><s%> them, and for My clothing <S%G2441><s%> they cast <S%G906><s%> lots. <S%G2819><s%>"

Therefore <S%G3767><s%> the soldiers <S%G4757><s%> did <S%G4160><s%> these <S%G3778><s%> things. <S%G3778><s%> But there were standing <S%G2476><s%> by the cross <S%G4716><s%> of Jesus <S%G2424><s%> His mother, <S%G3384><s%> and His mother's sister, <S%G79><s%> Mary <S%G3137><s%> the [wife] of Clopas, <S%G2832><s%> and Mary <S%G3137><s%> Magdalene. <S%G3094><s%>

When Jesus <S%G2424><s%> therefore <S%G3767><s%> saw <S%G3708><s%> His mother, <S%G3384><s%> and the disciple <S%G3101><s%> whom <S%G3739><s%> He loved <S%G25><s%> standing <S%G3936><s%> nearby, <S%G3936><s%> He said <S%G3004><s%> to His mother, <S%G3384><s%> "Woman, <S%G1135><s%> behold, <S%G2396><s%> your son! <S%G5207><s%>"

Then <S%G1534><s%> He said <S%G3004><s%> to the disciple, <S%G3101><s%> "Behold, <S%G2396><s%> your mother! <S%G3384><s%>" And from that hour <S%G5610><s%> the disciple <S%G3101><s%> took <S%G2983><s%> her into his own <S%G2398><s%> [household.]

After <S%G3326><s%> this, <S%G3778><s%> Jesus, <S%G2424><s%> knowing <S%G3609><s%> that all <S%G3956><s%> things <S%G3956><s%> had already <S%G2235><s%> been accomplished, <S%G5055><s%> in order <S%G2443><s%> that the Scripture <S%G1124><s%> might be fulfilled, <S%G5048><s%> said, <S%G3004><s%> "I am <S%G1372><s%> thirsty. <S%G1372><s%>"

A jar <S%G4632><s%> full <S%G3324><s%> of sour <S%G3690><s%> wine <S%G3690><s%> was standing <S%G2749><s%> there; so <S%G3767><s%> they put <S%G4060><s%> a sponge <S%G4699><s%> full <S%G3324><s%> of the sour <S%G3690><s%> wine <S%G3690><s%> upon [a branch of] hyssop, <S%G5301><s%> and brought <S%G4374><s%> it up to His mouth. <S%G4750><s%>

When <S%G3753><s%> Jesus <S%G2424><s%> therefore <S%G3767><s%> had received <S%G2983><s%> the sour <S%G3690><s%> wine, <S%G3690><s%> He said, <S%G3004><s%> "It is finished! <S%G5055><s%>" And He bowed <S%G2827><s%> His head, <S%G2776><s%> and gave <S%G3860><s%> up His spirit. <S%G4151><s%>

The Jews <S%G2453><s%> therefore, <S%G3767><s%> because <S%G1893><s%> it was the day <S%G3904><s%> of preparation, <S%G3904><s%> so <S%G2443><s%> that the bodies <S%G4983><s%> should not remain <S%G3306><s%> on the cross <S%G4716><s%> on the Sabbath <S%G4521><s%> (for that Sabbath <S%G4521><s%> was a high <S%G3173><s%> [day]), asked <S%G2065><s%> Pilate <S%G4091><s%> that their legs <S%G4628><s%> might be broken, <S%G2608><s%> and [that] they might be taken <S%G142><s%> away. <S%G142><s%>

The soldiers <S%G4757><s%> therefore <S%G3767><s%> came, <S%G2064><s%> and broke <S%G2608><s%> the legs <S%G4628><s%> of the first <S%G4413><s%> man, <S%G4413><s%> and of the other <S%G243><s%> man <S%G243><s%> who was crucified <S%G4957><s%> with Him;

but coming <S%G2064><s%> to Jesus, <S%G2424><s%> when <S%G5613><s%> they saw <S%G3708><s%> that He was already <S%G2235><s%> dead, <S%G2348><s%> they did not break <S%G2608><s%> His legs; <S%G4628><s%>

but one <S%G1520><s%> of the soldiers <S%G4757><s%> pierced <S%G3572><s%> His side <S%G4125><s%> with a spear, <S%G3057><s%> and immediately <S%G2117><s%> there came <S%G1831><s%> out blood <S%G129><s%> and water. <S%G5204><s%>

And he who has seen <S%G3708><s%> has borne <S%G3140><s%> witness, <S%G3140><s%> and his witness <S%G3141><s%> is true; <S%G228><s%> and he knows <S%G3609><s%> that he is telling <S%G3004><s%> the truth, <S%G227><s%> so <S%G2443><s%> that you also <S%G2532><s%> may believe. <S%G4100><s%>

For these <S%G3778><s%> things <S%G3778><s%> came <S%G1096><s%> to pass, <S%G1096><s%> that the Scripture <S%G1124><s%> might be fulfilled, <S%G4137><s%> "Not a bone <S%G3747><s%> of Him shall be broken. <S%G4937><s%>"
And again <S%G3825><s%> another <S%G2087><s%> Scripture <S%G1124><s%> says, <S%G3004><s%> "They shall look <S%G3708><s%> on Him whom <S%G3739><s%> they pierced. <S%G1574><s%>"

And after <S%G3326><s%> these <S%G3778><s%> things <S%G3778><s%> Joseph <S%G2501><s%> of Arimathea, <S%G707><s%> being <S%G1510><s%> a disciple <S%G3101><s%> of Jesus, <S%G2424><s%> but a secret <S%G2928><s%> [one,] for fear <S%G5401><s%> of the Jews, <S%G2453><s%> asked <S%G2065><s%> Pilate <S%G4091><s%> that he might take <S%G142><s%> away <S%G142><s%> the body <S%G4983><s%> of Jesus; <S%G2424><s%> and Pilate <S%G4091><s%> granted <S%G2010><s%> permission. <S%G2010><s%> He came <S%G2064><s%> therefore, <S%G3767><s%> and took <S%G142><s%> away <S%G142><s%> His body. <S%G4983><s%>

And Nicodemus <S%G3530><s%> came <S%G2064><s%> also, <S%G2532><s%> who had first <S%G4413><s%> come <S%G2064><s%> to Him by night; <S%G3571><s%> bringing <S%G5342><s%> a mixture <S%G3395><s%> of myrrh <S%G4666><s%> and aloes, <S%G250><s%> about <S%G5613><s%> a hundred <S%G1540><s%> pounds <S%G3046><s%> [weight].

And so <S%G3767><s%> they took <S%G2983><s%> the body <S%G4983><s%> of Jesus, <S%G2424><s%> and bound <S%G1210><s%> it in linen <S%G3608><s%> wrappings <S%G3608><s%> with the spices, <S%G759><s%> as is the burial <S%G1779><s%> custom <S%G1485><s%> of the Jews. <S%G2453><s%>

Now <S%G1161><s%> in the place <S%G5117><s%> where <S%G3699><s%> He was crucified <S%G4717><s%> there was a garden; <S%G2779><s%> and in the garden <S%G2779><s%> a new <S%G2537><s%> tomb, <S%G3419><s%> in which <S%G3739><s%> no <S%G3762><s%> one <S%G3762><s%> had yet <S%G3764><s%> been <S%G1510><s%> laid. <S%G5087><s%>

Therefore <S%G3767><s%> on account <S%G1223><s%> of the Jewish <S%G2453><s%> day <S%G3904><s%> of preparation, <S%G3904><s%> because <S%G3754><s%> the tomb <S%G3419><s%> was nearby, <S%G1451><s%> they laid <S%G5087><s%> Jesus <S%G2424><s%> there. <S%G1563><s%>
